title: Lin's 16 points helps Hornets swat away Clippers
text:
Lin's 16 points helps Hornets swat away Clippers 
CCTV.com Share this: Share on twitter Share on facebook Share on sinaweibo Share on email Font size: 
For some pre-season hoop action as the Charlotte Hornets played against the Los Angeles Clippers in Shenzhen. New Charlotte guard Jeremy Lin would try and lead his team over a short-handed Clipper team that was missing Chris Paul. 
Former NBA player Yi Jianlian gets some love from DeAndre Jordan and Blake Griffin before the game. 
Lin would be out in front of the pack in the opening q, and finishes with the lay-in to tie things. 
A finger injury kept Chris Paul on the bench for the exhibition game in Shenzhen. 
But they would still be Lob City -- DeAndre doing his thing after the pass from inside the paint -- and the Clips are within 3 
Blake Griffin would also get in on the act -- he finishes with 13 points, nine rebounds and 10 assists. 
NBA legend and Charlotte owner Michael Jordan then greets fans at the intermission. He got a rousing ovation. 
His team starts pulling away in the second half -- Lin finding a teammate underneath for the hoop 
The Charlotte guard hits the triple and puts the Hornets up by eight after three quarters. 
In the final Q, Lin collides with Josh Smith. The man with the crazy hair would suffer a bloody nose, but would return after treatment. He had a team-high 16 points and four assists. 
And his Hornets go on to win the first of two NBA China Games against the Clippers, 106-94. Related Videos
